config_description: GC Pauses greater than gc_warn_threshold_in_ms will be logged at WARN level Adjust the threshold based on your application throughput requirement. Setting to 0 will deactivate the feature.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' is used to set a threshold for logging GC pauses at WARN level. If the GC pauses are greater than the specified threshold, they will be logged. The configuration allows developers to adjust the threshold based on the application's throughput requirement. Setting the threshold to 0 will deactivate this feature.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' configuration depends on the frequency and duration of GC pauses in the system. If the GC pauses exceed the specified threshold, the configuration will be triggered to log the pauses at WARN level.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' configuration option on the system is that it can help developers identify and monitor GC pauses that exceed the specified threshold. This can be useful for troubleshooting performance issues related to garbage collection and optimizing the application's throughput.
